job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and mitigation plans.
  • Architect secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture and ensure secure design practices.
  • Monitor, detect, and respond to security threats, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures on AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • Secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems.
  • Optimize system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with security exposure.
  • Hands-on CI/CD tools: Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions.
  • Strong expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP with secure architecture focus.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Networking knowledge: LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers.
  • Familiarity with security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Monitoring tools: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM.
  • Scripting skills: Python, Bash, Shell.
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Diploma/B.Tech/MCA in IT, CS, or MCA.
  • Experience in SOC operations or SIEM/SOAR tools.
  • Certifications: AWS Security/DevOps Engineer – Professional, CKS, CEH, CompTia Security+.

Benefits

  • Growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead cybersecurity and DevSecOps practices, architect secure cloud infrastructures, and mentor teams to ensure secure-by-design systems.

job_description:
Project Manager

We are looking for a dynamic and detail-oriented Project Manager to join our team at 2Base Technologies. In this role, you will be responsible for the planning, execution, and successful delivery of projects while ensuring seamless coordination between teams and stakeholders. If you have a passion for technology, strong organizational skills, and the ability to manage multiple projects effectively, we’d love to hear from you!

Responsibilities

  • Develop and manage project plans, including timelines, budgets, and resource allocations.
  • Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with stakeholders.
  • Ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget while adhering to company policies, procedures, and quality standards.
  • Identify and manage project risks, issues, and dependencies, implementing mitigation strategies as needed.
  • Facilitate and document project meetings (kick-off, status updates, post-project evaluations), ensuring follow-ups are tracked.
  • Communicate project progress, challenges, and key updates to stakeholders, maintaining strong relationships with customers, vendors, and business partners.
  • Mentor and oversee team members, ensuring professional growth, training, and on-the-job delivery.
  • Oversee project teams (internal staff, external vendors, contractors), ensuring effective resource utilization.
  • Govern development, design, integration, and testing activities, ensuring best practices are followed.
  • Evaluate and optimize workflows, making recommendations for process improvements to enhance efficiency and delivery.
  • Coordinate cross-functional collaboration to ensure seamless integration of project components.

Job Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, Electronics, or a related technical field, or a combination of relevant education and experience.
  • 4–8 years of experience coordinating or managing projects in the IT industry.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities - Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs - Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented - Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation - Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them - Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams - Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams - Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle - Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements - Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation - Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines - Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details - Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation - Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements - 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles - Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation - Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control - Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly - Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes - Experience with project management systems and documentation tools - Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel - Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field

Benefits - A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: The Business Analyst translates business requirements into structured documentation, ensuring clarity and alignment across development teams. Responsibilities include creating BRDs/SRS, managing documentation, and supporting project delivery through traceable, accurate records.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Requirements

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.
  • Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst translates business needs into functional requirements, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure clear, testable documentation. Requires 4+ years of experience in SaaS or scalable products with strong analytical and communication skills.

job_description:
About the Company

Maple Tech Space (MTS) is a Canadian IT consultancy firm established in 2020, with headquarters in Ontario and offshore offices in Kerala, India. MTS specializes in IT consulting, digital marketing, app development, and web services. AgentRoof, a fast-growing PropTech division under MTS, empowers real estate professionals in Canada and the US with websites, CRM, lead generation, and social media marketing solutions.

Role & Responsibilities

As a Senior Business Development Manager, you will: - Sales Ownership & Strategy: Drive individual and team sales performance across US/Canada markets, ensuring consistent achievement of monthly and quarterly targets. - Cold Calling & Prospecting: Oversee outbound calling strategies; guide the team to maintain 60–80 outbound calls per day per rep while personally engaging in high-value prospecting. - Pitching & Presentations: Deliver and standardize impactful product pitches (websites, CRM, marketing services) and train the team on value-based selling. - Demo Management: Supervise scheduling, conducting, and closing of demos; lead complex demos and assist the team in deal closures. - Lead Conversion: Drive high lead-to-client conversion rates; ensure minimum monthly sign-up targets are met at both individual and team levels. - Client Retention: Build and manage key client relationships, drive upsell/cross-sell initiatives, and ensure renewals and long-term retention. - Team Management & Training: Recruit, onboard, train, mentor, and manage a team of Business Development Managers; conduct regular coaching, call reviews, and performance feedback sessions. - Performance Tracking: Set KPIs, monitor daily activities (calls, demos, conversions), and implement corrective actions to improve team performance. - CRM Management: Ensure accurate CRM usage, pipeline hygiene, activity tracking, and consistent follow-ups across the team. - Market Insights: Gather customer objections, competitor intelligence, and market trends; share insights with leadership to improve sales strategies and product offerings.

Requirements

  • Experience: 4–6+ years in outbound sales/business development for US/Canada clients, with at least 1–2 years in a team lead or managerial role (SaaS or Real Estate experience preferred).
  • Skills: Strong expertise in cold calling, product pitching, negotiation, deal closure, and sales coaching.
  • Language Proficiency: English – Mandatory (excellent spoken & written communication). Knowledge of Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, or other regional languages is a plus.
  • Personality: Highly driven, persuasive, energetic leader with strong influencing and decision-making abilities.
  • Performance: Proven track record of consistently achieving or exceeding individual and team sales targets.
  • Tech-Savvy: Hands-on experience with CRM tools, lead management systems, reporting dashboards, and virtual demo platforms (Zoom/Meet).
  • Flexibility: Willingness to work night shifts aligned with North American time zones.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary + attractive performance-based incentives.
  • Opportunity to work with a high-growth PropTech brand in Canada/US markets.
  • Fast career progression for high performers.
  • Work-from-home flexibility with international exposure.
  • Dynamic and young team culture.

Location: Work from Home (Night Shift: 6:00 PM – 3:00 AM IST) Industry: Real Estate Tech (Websites, CRM, Lead Generation & Marketing Services)

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@mapletechspace.com.
summary: Lead a sales team to drive revenue growth for a PropTech company, focusing on client acquisition, team management, and strategic sales execution in the US/Canada markets.

AI Centre of Excellence (CoE) Lead

We are seeking a visionary and execution-driven AI Centre of Excellence (CoE) Lead to establish and scale our artificial intelligence capabilities within the healthcare domain. You will act as the founder and chief architect of our AI practice, owning the strategy, platform, products, and delivery from inception to enterprise and global scale. This role blends deep technical leadership, healthcare domain expertise, and strong business ownership.

Key Responsibilities

AI Platform & Ecosystem Design - Define and build an enterprise-ready AI platform with modular architecture and reusable components. - Design and oversee multi-model orchestration, including LLMOps, MLOps, vector databases, and RAG pipelines. - Ensure scalability, reliability, observability, and cost efficiency across all AI services. - Establish platform standards for APIs, integrations, security, and monitoring.

Healthcare Product Strategy & Roadmap - Develop a clear AI product vision aligned to hospital and healthcare system needs. - Identify and prioritize use cases such as clinical decision support, revenue cycle automation, operational efficiency, and patient monitoring. - Drive an API-first, integration-friendly approach for EHRs and healthcare systems. - Own the roadmap from proof-of-concept to enterprise-grade products.

Value Articulation & Stakeholder Engagement - Translate complex AI capabilities into clear business value and ROI for healthcare leaders. - Create solution frameworks and outcome-based success metrics for customers. - Engage directly with C-suite stakeholders (CIO, CMIO, CFO, CEO) to shape adoption and investment decisions. - Support sales and growth teams with AI vision, demos, and executive-level narratives.

End-to-End Delivery & Execution - Lead the full lifecycle of AI initiatives: ideation, PoCs, MVPs, enterprise rollout, and global expansion. - Ensure delivery velocity while maintaining clinical safety, compliance, and quality. - Act as the escalation point for critical technical, delivery, or customer challenges. - Maintain hands-on involvement through reviews, key design decisions, and customer interactions.

Responsible AI, Security & Compliance - Embed Security-by-Design and Responsible AI principles across all platforms and products. - Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations and standards including HIPAA, FHIR, and PHI handling. - Define governance for model risk, bias, explainability, and auditability. - Work closely with legal, compliance, and security teams to meet clinical and regulatory requirements.

Business Growth & Partnerships - Own budgets, investment planning, and commercial outcomes for AI initiatives. - Convert AI use cases into sustainable revenue streams and long-term contracts. - Build strategic partnerships with cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP), AI model vendors, and healthcare system integrators. - Represent the AI CoE externally with partners, customers, and industry forums.

Team Building & CoE Leadership - Hire, mentor, and lead a high-performing team of ML engineers, data engineers, platform engineers, and solution experts. - Define the AI CoE operating model, best practices, and delivery standards. - Foster a culture of trust, innovation, ownership, and continuous learning.

Required Skills

  • Advanced degree in Computer Science, AI/ML, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Solid experience in senior leadership roles across product engineering, platforms, or technology-led businesses.
  • Proven experience building and scaling AI/ML or SaaS platforms from early stage to enterprise adoption.
  • Strong hands-on knowledge of Generative AI, LLMs, vector databases, cloud architecture, and enterprise security.
  • Deep understanding of healthcare systems, workflows, EHR integrations, and data privacy requirements.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Skills (Good to have)

  • Experience working with hospital networks or large healthcare providers.
  • Prior ownership of P&L, budgets, or revenue targets for technology products.
  • Exposure to global healthcare markets and multi-region deployments.
  • Experience defining Responsible AI frameworks in regulated industries.

Experience

12-15 years

Education & Certifications

  • Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).

Soft Skills

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to lead small tasks or mentor junior staff.
  • Capable of prioritizing and managing multiple tasks in high-pressure environments.
  • Willingness to work in on-call rotation and provide extended support when required.

Role Overview

The Pre-Sales Demo Executive is responsible for delivering a best-in-class demo and trial experience across the company’s SaaS portfolio. This senior individual contributor role requires strong ownership, attention to detail, and the ability to drive standards across multiple teams. The role owns the end-to-end demo readiness lifecycle, ensuring Sales, Pre-Sales, and Senior Leadership present a compelling product narrative to prospective customers.

  1. Demo Environment Ownership

  6. Demo Scenarios & Data Excellence

  7. Design, create, and maintain multiple demo scenarios per product, including role-based and industry-specific scenarios.
  8. Create realistic, high-quality demo datasets that showcase product value.
  9. Refresh and reset demo data to maintain consistency and reliability.

  10. Ensure all demo data complies with GDPR and internal data governance standards.

  11. Demo Flow Definition & Documentation

  12. Define and document ideal demo flows for each product, user role, and scenario.
  13. Maintain clear demo runbooks, scripts, and supporting guidance.

  14. Continuously refine demo flows based on feedback from Sales, Pre-Sales, and Leadership.

  15. Access & Credential Management

  16. Manage demo login credentials and access (manual process).
  17. Ensure credentials are secure, up to date, and readily available for internal use.
  18. Coordinate access approvals with the Pre-Sales Leader.

  19. Maintain clear documentation of demo users and permissions.

  20. Sales, Pre-Sales & Leadership Enablement

  21. Ensure demo readiness 3–5 days ahead of scheduled meetings.
  22. Support teams with demo confirmations, demo paths, and pre-meeting briefs.
  23. Provide concise daily or weekly summaries of planned demos and priorities.

  24. Attend key demos or leadership meetings where appropriate and value-adding.

  25. Meeting Preparation & Collateral Readiness

  26. Ensure leadership and sales teams have the correct decks, tools, and demo environments.
  27. Maintain a single source of truth for demo assets and supporting materials.

  28. Work closely with Product and Marketing teams to ensure consistent messaging.

  29. Standards, Governance & Continuous Improvement

  30. Establish and enforce a standard demo workflow across teams.
  31. Act as the quality gatekeeper for demo and trial experiences.
  32. Capture demo feedback and share insights with Product and Pre-Sales teams.
  33. Support long-term evolution towards PMO or Product Operations functions.

Preferred Skills

  • Experience in pre-sales, demo operations, product enablement, or SaaS operations roles.
  • Strong understanding of SaaS platforms and demo environments.
  • Ability to manage multiple systems and stakeholders.
  • Excellent documentation and organization skills.
  • Confident communicator with senior leadership.
  • Strong ownership mindset.
  • Experience supporting enterprise or regulated customers.
  • Familiarity with GDPR and data governance.
  • Exposure to CRM or pre-sales workflows.
  • Background suitable for PMO or delivery governance progression.

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

  • Meaningful Work with Global Impact: Contribute to enterprise platforms used by world-class organizations like Philips, Hitachi, and Pfizer.

  • Growth & Ownership: Continuous learning, ownership of work, and career growth in a supportive environment.
  • Global Exposure, Human Connection: Work with diverse teams and clients worldwide while feeling connected.
  • Quality, Security & Trust: Backed by ISO certifications for quality, data security, and operational reliability.

Build a Strong Future Together

At LTS, we support continuous learning, career development, and meaningful ownership of work. Our people benefit from a supportive work environment, competitive benefits, and a culture that values balance, trust, and long-term success.
